subject.normal: mysql-4.1.13 and RHEL and rpm was Re: mysql-4.1.13 and openssl-0.9.8 configuration issue

headers.subject: mysql-4.1.13 and RHEL and rpm was Re: mysql-4.1.13 and openssl-0.9.8 configuration issue
headers.received: from ns.pyerotechnics.com (HELO ns.pyerotechnics.com) (67.95.164.48) by lists.mysql.com (qpsmtpd/0.29) with ESMTP; Tue, 23 Aug 2005 19:06:42 +0200

body.para: Could you post your local mods and versions, if you need this, then others may too. Did you file a bug with redhat?
I am making the openssl-0.9.8-0 rpms right now.
table for you to fill in:
You do know that RH support will not be provided for your tar ball installs, nor will the up2date client bring you the latest patch versions.
On Tue, 23 Aug 2005, RedRed!com IT Department wrote:

quote.quotepara: I couldn't find the an rpm for the lastest version of zlib, openssl, etc...

I could use the mysql rpm but does it have all of the features and extras in it or does it come barebone? Does it know where to look for all of the necessary libraries and includes? I have never ventured into the rpm realm so I am not sure if they give me the same flexibility that compiling does.
Just curious, why not use the rpm to install? We use RHEL3 and RHEL4 here, every thing is done by rpm.
Is something missing? If so could you let us know, I would like to get the rpms patched.

body.footer: This message is for the designated recipient only and may contain privileged, proprietary, or otherwise private information. If you have received it in error, purge the message from your system and notify the sender immediately. Any other use of the email by you is prohibited.
